item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, May 14, 2025 at 5:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Bus stops here: Shanghai lets riders design their own routes (46 points | 9 comments)
2. Type-constrained code generation with language models (147 points | 54 comments)
3. RPG in a Box (29 points | 4 comments)
4. Show HN: I’ve built an IoT device to let my family know when I’m in a meeting (54 points | 36 comments)
5. Flattening Rust’s learning curve (134 points | 112 comments)
6. Branch Privilege Injection: Exploiting branch predictor race conditions (346 points | 133 comments)
7. Replicube: A puzzle game about writing code to create shapes (22 points | 1 comment)
8. Google is building its own DeX: First look at Android's Desktop Mode (258 points | 211 comments)
9. How “The Great Gatsby” took over high school (23 points | 19 comments)
10. Show HN: HelixDB – Open-source vector-graph database for AI applications (Rust) (140 points | 63 comments)
11. Failed Soviet Venus lander Kosmos 482 crashes to Earth after 53 years in orbit (124 points | 84 comments)
12. Launch HN: Miyagi (YC W25) turns YouTube videos into online, interactive courses (170 points | 94 comments)
13. Build real-time knowledge graph for documents with LLM (108 points | 17 comments)
14. Multiple security issues in GNU Screen (359 points | 216 comments)
15. Airbnb is in midlife crisis mode (103 points | 175 comments)
16. PDF to Text, a challenging problem (250 points | 148 comments)
17. Mipmap selection in too much detail (22 points | 6 comments)
18. Show HN: Mycelium (3 points | discuss)
19. It Awaits Your Experiments (149 points | 53 comments)
20. Garbage collection of object storage at scale (58 points | 8 comments)
21. A visual history of the safety pin (18 points | discuss)
22. Fingers wrinkle the same way every time they’re in the water too long (101 points | 39 comments)
23. Coffee for people who don't like coffee (57 points | 149 comments)
24. The world could run on older hardware if software optimization was a priority (627 points | 578 comments)
25. Map of Palaeohispanic Coins and Inscriptions (17 points | 1 comment)
26. A tool to verify estimates, II: a flexible proof assistant (33 points | discuss)
27. Cardiac: A CARDboard Illustrative Aid to Computation [pdf] (27 points | 13 comments)
28. DeepSeek’s founder is threatening US dominance in AI race (59 points | 47 comments)
29. I learned Snobol and then wrote a toy Forth (126 points | 32 comments)
30. ChatGPT may be polite, but it's not cooperating with you (9 points | 1 comment)
